title: Account Director (Advertising Agency)
description: Managing the client’s advertisement portfolio.
Preparing the client’s advertising plan.
Campaigning across a range of media vehicles including television, print, radio, digital, out-of-home, etc.
Fulfilling the client’s advertising needs and expectations.
Defining the media plan over a set time-frame.
Taking steps to meet client’s objectives within the budget.
Selecting the most competitive and appropriate media for the client’s industry.
Ensuring that the client’s requirements are understood and met.
Evaluating the effectiveness of the advertising campaign at the end of the review period.
keycompetencies: Knowledge of the entire cycle of advertising process.
Familiar with the fundamentals of advertising and marketing.
Skilled in analyzing consumer behaviour and consumption requirements.
Knowledge of developing a brand and communicating it through media vehicles.
Skilled in selecting media vehicles and preparing a media plan.
Skilled in estimating the costs involved with each media vehicle.
Efficient in presenting the campaign to the client.
Skilled in evaluating the effectiveness of the marketing campaign.
Familiar with the applicable legal and regulatory requirements.
careerpath: Head of Geographical Unit/Head of Sales/BD

title: Account Executive (Advertising Agency)
description: Co-ordinating with the creative teams within the agency.
Liaising with external vendors for production of advertisements.
Negotiating an agreeable fee on behalf of the client.
Presenting final work products to clients to obtain their approval.
Liaising between the client and the art and design departments.
Delivering the required advertising end-products.
Receiving the creative brief from advertiser and communicating it to the design team.
Overseeing the conceptualization of ideas by the art team to ensure execution of the brief.
Estimating agency fees to develop the advertisement.
Overseeing preparation of the advertisement to meet client’s requirements.
keycompetencies: Knowledge of the entire cycle of advertising process.
Familiar with the fundamentals of advertising and marketing.
Knowledge of preparing a brief for the creative/art and design teams.
Familiar with the production costs for a variety of advertisements across mediums.
Proficient in negotiating with third-party vendors.
Skilled in analyzing consumer behaviour and consumption requirements.
Knowledge of developing a brand and communicating it through media vehicles.
Skilled in presenting the campaign to the client.
Familiar with the applicable legal and regulatory requirements.
careerpath: Head of Geographical Unit/Head of Sales/BD

institutions: Sydenham College of Commerce and Economics

title: Actor and Actress
description: Playing different roles in theatrical, radio, television and radio productions for a live audience or before a recording camera.
keycompetencies: Knowledge of various acting techniques.
Ability to emote using different means.
Ability to portray a character.
Ability to memorize dialogues at length.
Ability to sing or dance.
Knowledge of more than one language.

institutions: Indian Film and Television Institute of India
Asian Academy of Film and Television

title: Advertisement Writer
description: Composing wording of advertisement, either in descriptive style or in form of slogans, captions, etc.
Writing descriptive matter or slogans in attractive form to advertise merits of product or establishment.
Brainstorming copy ideas and possible angles for client ad materials.
Preparing pitch concepts for clients.
Contributing original ideas for ad campaigns.
keycompetencies: Knowledge of different language styles that appeal to various target markets.
Proficient in writing clear, concise, grammatically correct copy.
Knowledge of different media like television, radio, newspaper, etc. to advertise effectively.
Well-versed with editing all textual matter for factual, syntax and typesetting discrepancies.
careerpath: Senior Content Writer? Senior Advertisement Writer

title: Animation Director
description: Recruiting and co-ordinating animation teams.
Leading each team from the beginning to the end of any given project.
Interpreting and communicating briefs to the animation teams.
Reviewing all work produced by animators and assistants.
Answering to the production department regarding schedule, budget and output.
Ensuring that the creative desires and production requirements are met.
keycompetencies: Skilled in designing complex graphics and animation using computer equipment.
Ability to track the process and progress of the project.
Knowledge of light manipulation, colours, textures, shadows, transparency, motion graphics, etc.
Ability to create 2D and 3D models, characters, simulations, multimedia presentations, technical illustrations, etc.
Knowledge of the fundamentals and principles of animation and film making.
Knowledge of story development, directing, cinematography, editing, storyboards, etc.
Skilled in scripting, planning and creating animated narrative sequences.
Knowledge of gadgets such as digital cameras, light pens, motion capture, etc.
Knowledge of the latest developments in the field of animation.

title: Animator
description: Generating creative concepts and ideas for production.
Researching and suggesting tools for production.
Evaluating timelines for production in accordance with the production schedule or supervisor.
Producing a sequence of 2D/3D images.
keycompetencies: Knowledge of the fundamentals and principles of animation.
Well-versed with posing and character emotion.
Knowledge of basic rules of animation including squash and stretch, anticipation, staging, straight action, post-to-pose, overlapping action, etc.
Proficient in life drawing including human anatomy, timing, appeal and secondary action.
Knowledge of intellectual property rights to ensure that the end-product, elements, artwork, etc. created is unique and does not infringe upon the rights of other products.
Knowledge of new media technology including what is good for the web, mobile, tablets.
Well-versed with CPM (Critical Path Method) and PERT (Program Evaluation and Review Technique).
Proficient in configuration management.

title: Author
description: Writing original literary works such as articles, stories, fictions, dramas, essays, poems and plays.
Collecting necessary data, and arranging it in required form for writing.
Writing stories essays, poems, plays, etc. in literary or in his own style.
Attending public meetings and press conferences to interview personalities and create news items.
keycompetencies: Knowledge of how to write original literary works such as articles, stories, fictions, dramas, essays, poems, plays, etc.
Well-versed with reporting or transmitting news item to editor.
Ability to write in a creative and original way.

title: Brand Manager
description: Liaising with principals to negotiate product pricing and maintain relationships.
Providing inputs with regards to product pricing and positioning through competitor analysis and market surveys/ benchmarking.
Planning and executing marketing business plans, based on market trends to promote presence in the global market.
Directing the sales team and designs innovative schemes to motivate them.
Recruiting and developing staff.
keycompetencies: Knowledge of the product and its pricing.
Detailed understanding of the market, the competitors, customers, products in the market and their pricing.
Ability to understand the marketing business plan and implement the same.
Knowledge of performance management.
Knowledge of recruiting and training staff.

title: Character Designer
description: Gathering visual references such as images, paintings, prints, murals, etc. to aid during animation process.
Preparing the character pack, including character design, construction detail, character line-up, etc.
Charting out the character dos and don’ts, size relationship chart, attitude poses, hand gestures, facial expressions, etc.
Studying the movement of characters and suggesting characteristics by shooting videos or acting.
Drawing out possibilities for each character on paper along with their clothing, accessories, etc.
keycompetencies: Skilled in life drawing including human anatomy, emotions, actions, expressions, mannerisms, etc.
Knowledge of human behaviour, facial expressions, walking style, animal anatomy, etc.
Skilled in the basics of theatre-acting and staging.
Knowledge of image editing software such as Adobe Photoshop, Gimp, etc.
Efficient in designing and developing characters consistent with the creative look of production and script.
Proficient in creating perspective drawings from all angles.
Efficient in mimicking any given character style according to the style suggested by the director.
Knowledge of the applicable copyright norms and intellectual property rights.
Knowledge of the latest designing and drawing techniques.

certifications.name: Adobe Certified Expert in Character Animation

title: Cinematographer
description: Photographing people, scenes and places with motion picture cameras for production of feature films.
Receiving instructions from Producer, Motion Picture as to the type and photographic effect desired on scenes to be filmed.
Directing loading of camera with reel of film.
Positioning or supervising setting up of camera by assistant; focussing and setting camera on scene or object to he shot; controlling lighting for desired effect.
Installing frame on camera table for exposure and positions overhead camera suspended securely over frame.
Shooting frame by frame in a predetermined sequence and regulates exposure and aperture to obtain special effect such as fade out or fade in.
Instructing laboratory technicians about method of processing of films, which need special treatment for effective development of striking feature of certain shots.
Unloading camera film for further processing.
Writing reports on details of shooting, lighting, etc.
Directing set up and other adjustments of camera.
keycompetencies: In-depth knowledge of various types of cameras, lenses, terminology used in cinematography, camera angles, etc.
Skilled in photography.
Working knowledge of the latest technology in cameras.
Competent with lighting techniques and directing the camera personnel accordingly.
Knowledge and ability to oversee lab work, select lens, exposure level and focus, enhance the mood and look of the film, use filters.

title: Colourist
description: Enhancing and/or correcting the colour, to reflect the desired creative style and mood of the production.
Merging various layers/elements created during post-production into a final product.
Enhancing and balancing a story’s content by maintaining its consistency.
Preparing and finalizing effort estimates and work plan in accordance to requirements.
Assessing the mood, creative look, style and visual treatment.
Understanding and assessing the media format, resolution and required format of the end output.
keycompetencies: Knowledge of relevant software required e.g. Silhouette, Nuke, Fusion, Combustion, Shake Premier, PF track, After Effects, Renderman, Quantel, Smoke, Flame, Avid, 3DS Max and FCP.
Knowledge of translating script requirements and post-production objectives into a schedule.
Knowledge of post-production techniques.
Familiar with the implications of each activity on time, materials, equipment, manpower and budget.
Familiar with the impact of each activity on the entire process workflow.
Skilled in estimating cost and time requirements.
Knowledge of applicable copyright norms and intellectual property rights.
Knowledge of the format, resolution and quality in which the material would need to be ingested, based on the intended final output.
Equipped in identifying issues with the raw material/footage prior to or during the ingest process.
Knowledge of the file-naming conventions appropriate to the production.
Knowledge of the theory of colour and depth.
Familiar with the principles and techniques of colour grading.
Basic knowledge of photography and lighting.
Knowledge of grading software such as Apple's Final Cut Pro, Adobe's After Effects and Premiere.
Knowledge of using colour grading equipment i.e. colour correctors, telecine and synchronizer.
Skilled in calibrating the software to the required colour space.
Knowledge of the best colouring practices prevalent in the domestic and international industry.

certifications.name: Adobe Certified Expert in Premiere Pro
Colorist Certification
certifications.provider: Indian Film and Television Technical Centre

title: Columnist
description: Reviewing events, developments, etc. of public interest.
Writing or editing copy for a regular column in a newspaper.
Delivering a unique and interesting column in order to keep readers hooked.
Researching and investigating local, national, and international events.
keycompetencies: Ability to work within strict deadlines.
Proficient in researching recent events within chosen specialty.
Familiar with interviewing people of interest pertaining to their article.
Proficiency in performing fact-checking.
Well-versed with composing article that is enjoyable and complies with journalism ethics and laws.
Familiar with composing articles which are captivating and appealing to a large group of people.
Ability to conduct taped or filmed interviews or narratives.
Proficient in transmitting news stories or reporting information from remote locations, using equipment such as satellite phones, telephones, fax machines or modems.
Familiar with editing videos for broadcast.

title: Compositor
description: Understanding the post-production requirements and planning the process and workflow.
Merging various layers/elements created during post-production into a final product.
Using computer-generated effects, colour grading, digital intermediate, screen conversion, rendering, rotoscopy, keying, match moving and compositing to achieve end-results.
Preparing and finalizing effort estimates and work plan in accordance to the requirements.
Managing interim work-products during post-production.
Ensuring work-products are distribution- or exhibition-ready as per the required technical specifications.
Gathering raw material, which could include characters, layouts, props/objects, effects and layers.
Compositing all elements together using software and preparing the final output.
keycompetencies: Knowledge of principles of animation and visual effects.
Basic knowledge of the process of film-making and game development.
Basic knowledge of post-production techniques.
Familiar with the relevant equipment and software e.g. Silhouette, Nuke, Fusion, Combustion, Shake Premier, PF track, After Effects, Renderman, Quantel, Smoke, Flame, Avid, 3DS Max and FCP.
Knowledge of the implications of each activity on time, materials, equipment, manpower and budget.
Knowledge of the domestic and international post-production best practices prevalent in the industry.

institutions: Indian Institute of Art and Design
Sophia College of Arts and Commerce

title: Creative Writer
description: Developing the basic presentation approaches.
Directing the layout design and copywriting for promotional material.
Reviewing materials and information presented by the client.
Discussing various production factors to determine the most desirable presentation concept.
Conferring with heads of art, copywriting and production departments to discuss the client requirements and scheduling.
Outlining the basic presentation concepts and co-ordinating the creative activities.
Reviewing and approving the art and copy materials developed by staff.
Presenting final layouts to the client for approval.
keycompetencies: Ability to make a presentation.
Ability to understand the client’s requirement and brief various teams like copywriting, art, production, etc.
Ability to do research.
Proficiency in expressing emotions, imaginative ideas, etc.
Ability to present the internal teams’ idea to the client and get the approval.

institutions: Lady Shri Ram College for Women

title: Director, Music
description: Selecting music, singers and instrumental musicians.
Setting music to the required tunes.
Conducting rehearsals with the artists.
Supervising the recording of playback music.
keycompetencies: Understanding of various musical theories.
Detailed knowledge of Indian and Western music.
Ability to create musical pieces.
Ability to create music with singers and musicians.
Knowledge of various musical instruments.
Ability to play one or more musical instrument.
Ability to render vocal music.
Ability to direct group or orchestral music.

title: Director, Theatrical
description: Selecting appropriate Actors, other staff members, outdoor location, etc. for a production.
Directing rehearsals.
Co-ordinating and supervising activities of Cameramen, Scenery Designers, Sound Technicians, property men, etc.
Supervising the set-up of sets and stage.
Directing the film, drama or any other production.
keycompetencies: Ability to visualize the final artwork.
Ability to understand film language.
Knowledge of screenplay analysis.
Detailed knowledge of various cinematographic techniques.
Ability to edit the final piece of work.
Ability to manage Actors and other staff.
Ability to handle business management.
Competent in directing mythological, social or historical films or stage performances.

title: Executive Producer
description: Overseeing the entire content production process.
Managing twin goals of achieving the creative vision and meeting cost objectives.
keycompetencies: Skilled in undertaking research and collecting relevant information to support production concepts, ideas and scripts.
Knowledge of available production techniques and implications for selecting a particular technique.
Skilled in selecting candidates from the available sources.
Skilled in preparing synopsis, plot summaries, proposals and presentations.

institutions: Lady Shri Ram College for Women

title: Freelance Journalist
description: Contributing to newspapers or magazines.
Writing special articles on subjects of choice for publication.
keycompetencies: Well-versed with collecting and analysing information about news worthy events to write news stories for publications.
Knowledge of developing news leads and news tips to develop story idea.
Proficient in interviewing people in a range of different circumstances.
Knowledge of writing story according to prescribed editorial style and format standards.
Well-versed with investigating leads and gathering facts.
Knowledge of writing local, regional and national breaking stories like political events, sports, conflicts, etc.
Proficient in writing national stories with speed and accuracy.
Knowledge of writing feature articles.

title: Lighting Artist
description: Adding light and shadows to the production in accordance to the established creative style.
keycompetencies: Knowledge of theory and principles of lighting, shadows, exposure, natural light, and colour space, reflections, etc.
Well-versed with fundamentals of photography, lighting optimization and cinematography.
Knowledge of software tools such as 3D studio max, Autodesk maya, Softimage etc.
Competent in  visualiziing a scene under different lighting conditions.
Knowledge Understanding of the traditional techniques of lighting including techniques used in theatrical stage lighting, product lighting etc.
careerpath: Art Director/Production Manager ? Movement to other occupation

title: Location Manager
description: Ensuring that the filming/production is taking place on location.
Evaluating various locations and identifying those that are most suited for filming.
Deciding set-up and logistics.
Co-ordinating at the filming location.
keycompetencies: Knowledge of relevant approvals and permissions (from local, state or central authorities) required for filming at a location.
Basic knowledge of IT modules.
Basic knowledge of design and production.
Knowledge of film making or content production.
Knowledge of planning and organizing promotional events.
Knowledge of play-out equipment and software required for broadcasting live events.
Skilled in conducting location research.
Proficient in English language.

title: Manager, Advertising and Promotion
description: Planning and directing advertising policies and programmes.
Producing collateral materials such as posters, contests, coupons or give-aways to create extra interest in the purchase of a product.
Conferring with clients to provide marketing or technical advice.
Co-ordinating activities of departments such as sales, graphic arts, media, finance and research.
Formulating plans to extend business with established accounts and to transact business as agent for advertising accounts.
Identifying and developing contacts for promotional campaigns.
Estimating and controlling expenditures to administer approved budget.
keycompetencies: Knowledge of advertising concepts.
Ability to plan long term financial and business objectives.

title: Market Research Analyst
description: Researching market conditions in local, regional or national areas to determine potential sales.
Gathering market information on competitors, prices, sales and methods of marketing and distribution.
Using survey results to create a marketing campaign based on regional preferences and buying habits.
Collecting and analysing data on customer demographics, preferences, needs and buying habits to identify potential markets.
Conducting research on consumer opinions and marketing strategies.
Collaborating with marketing professionals, statisticians, pollsters and other professionals.
Developing and implementing procedures for identifying advertising needs.
Monitoring industry statistics and following trends in trade literature.
Preparing reports of findings, illustrating data graphically and translating complex findings into written text.
keycompetencies: Knowledge of media and entertainment industry, market trends, competitors, etc.
Working knowledge of qualitative and quantitative research methods.
In-depth knowledge of devising and evaluating methods.
Thorough knowledge of data collection, analysis and presentation using computer tools/software.
Knowledge of latest market trends of the industry and sub-sectors.

title: News Reporter
description: Collecting news by touring area allotted to him/her.
Interviewing persons, attending public functions, press conferences and law courts.
Investigating events of public interest and transmitting news to editor for publication.
Interviewing important public men to collect news and to ascertain their views on contemporary events.
Reporting or transmitting news item to editor giving background history and comments.
keycompetencies: Proficient in interacting with people.
Knowledge of current affairs, both Indian and international.
Proficient in researching to get the detailed background of the story.
Well-versed with names of notable personalities both in Indian and abroad.
Proficient in spotting events that can be converted into news - that is news-worthy.
Proficient in writing about particular type of news such as those relating to political events, sports, theatre, etc.

certifications.name: Indian Government's Certification in Journalism
certifications.provider: Ministry of Information and Broadcasting, India

title: Photographer Aerial
description: Photographing objects, places and areas of vital importance from aeroplanes in flight, for use in surveys, planning, development and other scientific and military purposes.
Operating and maintaining automatic cameras and photo equipment for aerial photographs.
Developing aerial films of various types in automatic, semi-automatic or manual tank developers.
Making prints for photo interpretation.
keycompetencies: In-depth knowledge of various types of cameras, lens, terminology used in photography, camera angles, etc.
Knowledge of measuring day light using exposing meter, focusing lens and adjusting lens opening and exposure time.
Knowledge of loading camera, adjusting exposure-time and exposing film by opening shutter at calculated intervals.
In-depth understanding of determining number of exposures and time lapse between them.
Working knowledge of pressing lever to open lens shutter and exposing film or plate by pressing lever, allowing time, if necessary and removing negative from camera.
Working knowledge of photo printing, enlarging, fixing solutions, etc.

institutions: Srishti Institute of Art Design and Technology

title: Photographer General
description: Taking photographs of persons, places, or other subjects, using various kinds of photographic equipment.
Taking colour photographs and developing colour films adopting special processes.
Arranging artificial lighting and holding or placing camera at desired angle and distance from subject to be photographed.
Loading camera with film or plate.
Developing negatives in darkroom by dipping it in developers, washing it in fixing solution and further washing it in water and allowing developed film to dry.
Examining developed films for defects, and retouching negative using pencil or brush after applying retouching medium.

Making prints or enlargements in sensitized paper; drying them by grazing on glazing-sheet or by spreading on flat surface and trimming glazed or unglazed prints according to required size and mounting them.
Specialising in studio photography, taking photographs of important events for reproduction in newspapers, buildings, machinery, industrial plants, for trade advertisements.
keycompetencies: In-depth knowledge of various types of cameras, lens, terminology used in photography, camera angles, etc.
Knowledge of measuring day light using exposing meter, focusing lens and adjusting lens opening and exposure time.
Working knowledge of pressing lever to open lens shutter and exposing film or plate by pressing lever, allowing time, if necessary and removing negative from camera.
Working knowledge of photo printing, enlarging, fixing solutions, etc.

title: Photographer News
description: Photographing news events, persons or objects for use in news-papers, magazines and other publications.
Receiving instructions from news editor or chief reporter regarding nature of pictures to be taken.
Traveling to various locations and waiting for the most suitable moment to take photographs.
Attending state functions and parties and taking photographs of important people arousing special interest of news value for publication.
Accompanying important visitors and dignitaries and taking photographs of significant events associated with important people.
Removing exposed film for negatives with sound negative and filling up void portions with necessary music track.
keycompetencies: In-depth knowledge of various types of cameras, lens, terminology used in photography, camera angles, etc.
Knowledge of measuring day light using exposing meter, focusing lens and adjusting lens opening and exposure time.
Working knowledge of pressing lever to open lens shutter and exposing film or plate by pressing lever, allowing time, if necessary and removing negative from camera.
Working knowledge of photo printing, enlarging, fixing solutions, etc.
Knowledge of current affairs and daily news.

title: Producer, Film
description: Producing motion picture or films for public entertainment.
Studying the script and costumes to help select the Actor and Actress.
Arranging for the proper studio setting.
Co-ordinating the activities of Film Director, Actor, Actress, Cameraman, Music Director and Sound Recordist.
Liaising with the Film Distributor.
keycompetencies: Ability to manage a film production.
Knowledge of how a film is made.
Ability to arrange for the various film-related requirements.
Ability to understand finances.
Ability to perform the functions of a Film Director.

certifications.name: Certified Film Producer (CFP)
certifications.provider: Film and Television Institute of India (FTII)

certifications.name: Post Production Certification
certifications.provider: Asian Academy of Film and Television (AAFT)

title: Production Manager (Motion Picture)
description: Provides assistance in producing motion picture or films for public entertainment.
Preparing a time schedule for the film from start to end with relation to manpower, resources and equipment usage.
Arranging for advance hiring of studios and processing laboratories, wherever applicable.
Conducting location surveys for outdoor shooting.
Making available various requirements like costumes, decoration, etc. for the shoot.
Making travel arrangements for the crew for outdoor shooting.
Liaising with the artists, director, theatrical and others.
keycompetencies: Ability to manage a film production.
Knowledge of how a film is made.
Ability to arrange for the various film-related requirements.

certifications.name: Certified Film and Television Producer
certifications.provider: Film and Television Institute of India

title: Public Relations Officer
description: Liaising between the organization and general public for promoting goodwill.
Distributing publicity material and issuing press releases to popularize organization’s activties.
Studying newspapers, journals, etc., to identify trends of public opinion on policies and activities of the organization.
Assisting the employer to understand public opinion and criticism of policies.
Meeting press and public representatives to explain special features of the organization.
Distributes publicity material, arranges film shows, etc. to cultivate appreciation of organization's activities.
Arranging visits of important persons and organizing special parties, to establish a platform for explaining the activities of the organization.
Participates in exhibitions and displays posters, charts, models, etc. to public.
Selecting suitable publicity material.
Writing special features, articles, reports or pamphlets.
Participating and getting photographs/video taken of important functions.
Editing journals or periodicals, for publicising activities of the organization.
Maintaining information centre and organizing community relations activities.
keycompetencies: Ability to stay updated with current events.
Knowledge of using social networking and other forms of media for publicity.
Basic knowledge of IT modules.
Skilled in developing publicity strategies and campaigns.
Knowledge of writing publicity material.
Basic knowledge of design and production.
Knowledge of planning and organizing promotional events.
Skilled in conducting market research.
Proficient in English language.

title: Publicity Officer
description: Preparing publicity material for the organization.
Releasing the material through press, screen or radio/TV.
Ensuring effective publicity for organization.
Preparing news release scripts, salient features and other publicity materials to be published.
Publicizing publicity material through appropriate media.
Displaying the material at important places, exhibitions, films, newspapers, radio/TV and through personal contacts.
Scrutinizing newspapers and magazines to collect news, to ensure effective publicity related to the publicized material.
Touring area and contacting public to promote mutual goodwill.
Liaising with press representatives.
keycompetencies: Ability to stay up-to-date with current events.
Basic knowledge of IT modules.
Skilled in developing publicity strategies and campaigns.
Knowledge of writing publicity materials.
Basic knowledge of design and production.
Knowledge of planning and organizing promotional events.
Skilled in conducting market research.
Proficient in English language.

title: Rigging Artist
description: Creating computer-generated controls.
Creating rigs for movements in models used for animation.
Determining the rigs to be built by understanding the story and characters.
Creating prototypes/pilots for testing.
Checking the final rigs to ensure they are clean, efficient, have realistic movements and are animation friendly.
keycompetencies: Well-versed with the principles of 3D modelling and animation.
Knowledge of human anatomy, skeleton structure, joints, etc.
Proficient in calculating a rig.
Knowledge of rigging principles, processes, systems, etc.
Well-versed in writing computer scripts and programmes to create the desired rigs in models.
Knowledge of software like Autodesk Maya, 3D Studio Max, Blender, etc.
Proficient in programming languages like C, C++, Python, etc.
Knowledge of copyright norms and intellectual rights.
Proficient in testing rigs using phonemes test, extreme animation test, jewel motion test, etc.

title: Roto Artist
description: Understanding requirements for post-production.
Planning the process for post-production.
Breaking down content into individual frames or elements and modify according to requirement.
Preparing and finalising effort estimates and work plan in accordance to requirements.
keycompetencies: Knowledge about post-production techniques that would apply to the current production.
Proficiency in handling the relevant equipment and software required.
Ability to translate script requirements and post-production objectives into a schedule that could cover the workflow, key activities, deliverables and timelines.
Knowledge of the implications of each activity on time, materials, equipment, manpower and budget.
Knowledge about the impact of each activity on the entire process workflow (Supervisor).
Ability to estimate the cost and time it would take to keeping in mind the intended visual style.
Well versed with domestic and International post-production best practices prevalent in the industry.
Knowledge of applicable copyright norms and intellectual property rights.
Knowledge of applicable health and safety guidelines.
careerpath: Lead Artist  ? Movement to other occupation

title: Script Editor
description: Reading and assessing the script for the merit of the story, its dramaturgy and overall competence.
Offering feedback and notes for improvement to make the script production worthy.
keycompetencies: Proficient in ways to assess scripts and narrative styles, diagnose weaknesses and identify changes required.
Well-versed with the principles of story-telling and character psychology.
Knowledge of locating the scripts premise, assessing it for its dramatic strength and clarity and matching it to the version approved by the production house.
Adept with assessing the unity of the script i.e. to ensure that all key sequences draw their dramatic energy from the central idea/premise.
Proficient in confirming the integrity between the character and the plot.
Adept with assess if the screenplay’s structure is in line with requirements and if there is accessible clarity to the narrative’s progression.
Ability to assess every scene to confirm if the division is correct vis-a-vis time and location and to evaluate its placement in the progression of the screenplay.
Well-versed with examining dialogues for their rhythm, uniqueness of voice, economy of style and assessing if they serve in driving the narrative forward and in revealing the characters.
Knowledge of concepts relating to general topics (like history, mythology, politics, technology) to identify gaps in logic, authenticity and credibility.

Knowledge of elements of the script i.e. character, conflict, premise, story, narrative structure, causality, turning points, story development, story set-ups in opening sequence, genre, plot and story, setting, structure and theme.
Proficient in working on word processing software and scriptwriting, formatting software like Final Draft, Movie Magic and Celtx.
Adept with typing in regional languages using Unicode.
Well-versed with applicable copyright norms and intellectual property rights to protect work and sign contracts.

certifications.name: Film and Television Institute of India (FTII) Certificate
Indian Institute of Mass Communications (IIMC) Certificate

title: Script Researcher
description: Providing research material to the scriptwriter.
Carrying out research or developing outlines to identify possible scripts/stories.
keycompetencies: Proficient in constructing a story and develop a script for different types of productions.
Knowledge of the essentials of scriptwriting including characters, characterization, plotting, structure and dramaturgy.
Well-versed with script-writing norms and guidelines including style, format, structure and length applicable to different industries, audiences, genres, regions, language and cultures.
Adept with the context of the script with reference to other similar existing work.
Knowledge of elements of the story outline including the story plot, structure, theme, setting, character profiles, key turning points in the story.
Well-versed with basic research methodology.
Proficient in working on word processing software and screenwriting, formatting software like Final Draft, Movie Magic and Celtx.
Adept with typing in regional language using Unicode.
Knowledge of narrative templates like the 3-act structure, plot point, Blake Snyder’s beat sheet (save the cat) and hero’s journey.
Well-versed with the sources for procuring information/ background material and research.
